Rhodia presents its cost-effective and
eco-friendly surfactant technologies at
Cesio 2008
News release

front.div:
Paris (France) andBristol(PA,USA) -June 23, 2008-Improved cost-effectiveness and eco-friendly properties are the key factors strengthening
Rhodia's position as a global leader in the specialty surfactant market.
Rhodia provides innovative surfactant systems -structured surfactant liquids, polymeric and eco-friendly surfactants -for use in home and personal care,
agrochemicals and other industrial applications.
Rhodia uses sustainable chemistry to develop surfactant-based systems in partnership with customers delivering the following benefits:
 Cost-effective performance: increased process efficiency, energy and raw materials savings, highly-concentrated products;
 Sustainability: renewable resources utilization, eco-friendly product profile.
For the Personal Care market, Rhodia has designed Miracare® Plaisant, a new plant-based surfactant system that offers an eco-friendly solution for mild
and refreshing cleansing. Miracare® Plaisant is based on biodegradable and renewable ingredients, while providing flexibility and cost efficiency to
formulators.
In the Agrochemicals market, Geronol® CF/AR, a surfactant based-system, is a bio-activator for water soluble actives. It has an excellent tox and eco-
tox profile and is extremely compatible with concentrated glyphosate formulations and co-herbicides.
In Industrial applications, Rhodibloc® RS, a surfactant booster for emulsion stabilization, uses innovative chemistry for the industrial production of block
copolymers. It provides a cost-effective process solution for stabilization of water-in-oil emulsions, preventing coalescence and flocculation.
Rhodia's Novecare Enterprise supplies a large range of surfactants — cationic, anionic, non-ionic and amphoteric — delivering multi-functions adapted
to specific applications, including foaming effect, surface modification, cleansing, emulsion, rheology, environmental and health protection.
